titleStmt.title: Truths triumpant; or, A familiar epistle from the Muffty of the Grand Cham of Tartary, to those fathers of falshood the Jesuites, whose superstitious doctrines are not only detected but derided, and reasons and natures eyes opened.

notesStmt.note: Verse: "Vast superstition! Glorious stile of weakness! ..."

On the same sheet, a letter explaining where the poem was found; signed: Philopatris. Philalethies.; text of letter begins: Right honourable, and noble patron of the religion, laws and libertys of all the free born people of England, ..".
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
